intro: Coussarea talamancana, commonly known as the Talamancan coussarea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in whorls around the stem. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
